title: Most packages failing with "cd: <dir>: No such file or directory"
body:
I suspect this is some issue with my environment (Mac), but I can't for the life of me figure it out. Most  packages I attempt to install fail with a similar error; only the directory the cd fails on seems to vary.

```
cavern% pwd
/Users/aat
cavern% git clone https://github.com/spack/spack.git
Cloning into 'spack'...
remote: Enumerating objects: 85, done.
remote: Counting objects: 100% (85/85), done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (56/56), done.
remote: Total 194755 (delta 35), reused 35 (delta 17), pack-reused 194670
Receiving objects: 100% (194755/194755), 72.61 MiB | 5.37 MiB/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (86594/86594), done.
Updating files: 100% (5567/5567), done.
cavern% cd spack
cavern% cd bin
cavern% ./spack install libelf
==> Warning: clang@11.0.0-apple cannot build optimized binaries for "skylake". Using best target possible: "x86_64"
==> Installing libelf
==> Searching for binary cache of libelf
==> No binary for libelf found: installing from source
==> Fetching https://fossies.org/linux/misc/old/libelf-0.8.13.tar.gz
######################################################################################################################## 100.0%
==> Staging archive: /var/folders/f9/mz2448js3l9076gcls3k_yt40000gn/T/aat/spack-stage/spack-stage-libelf-0.8.13-ui4nt6qzbmejbvasboz2s5rp2uyj7zai/libelf-0.8.13.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /var/folders/f9/mz2448js3l9076gcls3k_yt40000gn/T/aat/spack-stage/spack-stage-libelf-0.8.13-ui4nt6qzbmejbvasboz2s5rp2uyj7zai
==> No patches needed for libelf
==> Building libelf [AutotoolsPackage]
==> Executing phase: 'autoreconf'
==> Executing phase: 'configure'
==> Executing phase: 'build'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 2:
    'make' '-j8'

2 errors found in build log:
     72    creating libelf.pc
     73    creating config.h
     74    creating lib/sys_elf.h
     75    ==> Executing phase: 'build'
     76    ==> [2020-02-08-18:24:05.076997] 'make' '-j8'
     77    making all in lib
  >> 78    /bin/sh: line 0: cd: lib: No such file or directory
  >> 79    make: *** [all-recursive] Error 1

See build log for details:
  /var/folders/f9/mz2448js3l9076gcls3k_yt40000gn/T/aat/spack-stage/spack-stage-libelf-0.8.13-ui4nt6qzbmejbvasboz2s5rp2uyj7zai/spack-build-out.txt
```

The lib directory is present in the stage directory, so there's something else going on :(

```
$ ls /var/folders/f9/mz2448js3l9076gcls3k_yt40000gn/T/aat/spack-stage/spack-stage-libelf-0.8.13-ui4nt6qzbmejbvasboz2s5rp2uyj7zai/spack-src
COPYING.LIB    Makefile       acconfig.h     config.h       config.sub*    lib/           po/
ChangeLog      Makefile.in    aclocal.m4     config.h.in    configure*     libelf.pc      stamp-h
INSTALL        README         config.cache   config.log     configure.in   libelf.pc.in   stamp-h.in
MANIFEST       VERSION        config.guess*  config.status* install-sh*    mkinstalldirs*
```

Installing `zlib` works though:

```
cavern% ./spack install zlib
==> Warning: clang@11.0.0-apple cannot build optimized binaries for "skylake". Using best target possible: "x86_64"
==> Installing zlib
==> Searching for binary cache of zlib
==> No binary for zlib found: installing from source
==> Fetching http://zlib.net/fossils/zlib-1.2.11.tar.gz
######################################################################################################################## 100.0%
==> Staging archive: /var/folders/f9/mz2448js3l9076gcls3k_yt40000gn/T/aat/spack-stage/spack-stage-zlib-1.2.11-cvrek7vtvob6v2dfnvdowu2rkqtqtmmi/zlib-1.2.11.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /var/folders/f9/mz2448js3l9076gcls3k_yt40000gn/T/aat/spack-stage/spack-stage-zlib-1.2.11-cvrek7vtvob6v2dfnvdowu2rkqtqtmmi
==> No patches needed for zlib
==> Building zlib [Package]
==> Executing phase: 'install'
==> Successfully installed zlib
  Fetch: 1.72s.  Build: 2.84s.  Total: 4.55s.
[+] /Users/aat/spack/opt/spack/darwin-catalina-x86_64/clang-11.0.0-apple/zlib-1.2.11-cvrek7vtvob6v2dfnvdowu2rkqtqtmmi
```

Any ideas?
